titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jeremy Reed Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 8, 2019 at 04:02

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Jeremy Reed Papers document the writing of Jeremy Reed and include drafts of poetry, prose and translations, notebooks containing poetry drafts, correspondence with David Gascoyne, Kathleen Raine, Enitharmon Press, and others, and a small amount of contractual material related to the publishing of Reed's work. The papers include holograph drafts and printouts of most of Reed's writings between the early 1980s and 2007. Most of the drafts are corrected and accompanied by correspondence with editors.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This finding aid describes a collection that has been acquired by the library in discrete segments over time. The narrative sections of the finding aid provide information about the content and context of the collection. The Collection Contents section provides a general description and a box or folder listing of the various acquisitions of the collection. The Processing Notes section provides information about the way and extent to which the library has processed this collection. The Arrangement section provides information about how material within this collection is organized and tips on how to locate material across various acquisitions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from R. A. Gekoski Booksellers on the George Henry Nettleton Fund and the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 1998-2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Access to original audiovisual recordings in Boxes 21-22 is restricted. Consult Access Services for information about reference copies.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Jeremy Reed Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jeremy Reed Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Jeremy Reed Papers is comprised of material formerly classed as Uncat MS Vault 871, Uncat MSS 363, Uncat MSS 964, and Uncat MS Vault 825.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2009.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are organized into six groupings: October 1998 Acquisition, November 1999 Acquisition, September 2002 Acquisition, May 2007 Acquisition, and August 2007 Acquisition, and May 2010 Acquisition. Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, correspondence can be found in all six groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.

bioghist.head: Jeremy Reed, 1951-
bioghist.p: Jeremy Reed, British author, was born March 6, 1951 in Jersey, Channel Islands. A prolific poet, novelist and translator, Reed has authored dozens of volumes of poetry, prose and cultural analysis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jeremy Reed Papers document the writing of Jeremy Reed and include drafts of poetry, prose and translations, notebooks containing poetry drafts, correspondence with David Gascoyne, Kathleen Raine, Enitharmon Press, and others, and a small amount of contractual material related to the publishing of Reed's work. The papers include holograph drafts and printouts of most of Reed's writings between the early 1980s and 2007. Most of the drafts are corrected and accompanied by correspondence with editors.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Formerly classed as Uncat MS Vault 825.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Enclosures include a broadside of the poem "Rondel for the Fourth Decade" and two photographs of David Gascoyne.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Formerly classed as Uncat MS Vault 871.
